Line 3: Starting at (0.0781, 0.0781) and ending at (0, 0.0781). 4. Line 4: Starting at (0, 0.0781) and ending at (0, 0). Next, create a second rectangle by drawing four lines on the XY plane: 1. Line 1: Starting at (0.0075, 0.0075) and ending at (0.0706, 0.0075). 2. Line 2: Starting at (0.0706, 0.0075) and ending at (0.0706, 0.0706). 3. Line 3: Starting at (0.0706, 0.0706) and ending at (0.0075, 0.0706). 4. Line 4: Starting at (0.0075, 0.0706) and ending at (0.0075, 0.0075). Apply a scale factor of 0.0781 to the entire sketch. Transform the sketch into a 3D sketch using euler angles (0, 0, 0) and a translation vector of (0, 0, 0). Extrude the sketch into a 3D prism with an extrusion depth towards the normal of 0.75 and no extrusion in the opposite direction. **Part 2: Create a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with a rotation around Z of -90 degrees and a translation vector of (0.0156, 0, 0). Draw four lines on the XY plane to create a rectangle. The rectangle should be larger than the bottom face of Part 1: 1. Line 1: Starting at (0, 0) and ending at (0.25, 0). 2. Line 2: Starting at (0.25, 0) and ending at (0.25, 0.25). 3. Line 3: Starting at (0.25, 0.25) and ending at (0, 0.25). 4. Line 4: Starting at (0, 0.25) and ending at (0, 0). Apply a scale factor of 0.25 to the entire sketch. Transform the sketch into a 3D sketch using euler angles (0, 0, 0) and a translation vector of (0, 0, 0). Perform a cut operation with Part 1 and the new prism. Set the extrusion depth towards the normal to 0 and the extrusion depth in the opposite direction to 0.0625.</description>
